results.name: Trends in Obesity Among Pennsylvania Students
results.description: In an analysis of childhood obesity rates among students in Philadelphia Pennsylvania, researchers found that over 7 school years, the prevalence of childhood obesity declined about 1%.

results.name: BMI and Health in Low- and Middle-Income Countries
results.description: This study investigated whether the relationship between body mass index and poor self-rated health differed by sex in low-income countries and middle-income countries.

results.name: Tobacco Use Screening During Outpatient Visits
results.description: In this study researchers assess the prevalence, correlates, and trends of tobacco use screening and cessation assistance offered to US adults during their hospital outpatient clinic visits.

results.name: Perceptions of Tobacco Quitlines
results.description: The objective of this study was to better understand basic knowledge and perceptions of quitlines among populations that have a disproportionate share of tobacco-related morbidity and mortality and are underrepresented in quitline research.

results.name: A Review of Mall Walking Programs
results.description: Researchers summarize the evidence on the health-related value of mall walking and mall walking programs.

results.name: Quality of Fruits and Vegetables in Montana
results.description: Researchers found a significant difference in the quality of fruits in vegetables available in rural and less rural grocery stores in Montana.

results.name: Beyond Neighborhood Food Environments
results.description: In this article researchers examine the relevance of different definitions of food environments.

results.name: Prostate Cancer Screening
results.description: The study objectives were to examine prostate screening at 5 time points over a 12-year period among American Indian/Alaska Native men aged 50 to 75 years, and to compare their screening rates to African American men and white men in the same age group.

results.name: Hospital Support of Breastfeeding
results.description: The purpose of this study was to assess hospital policy compliance with New York laws and regulations related to breastfeeding.

results.name: Hookah-Related Twitter Chatter
results.description: In this study, researchers explored normalization or discouragement of hookah smoking, and other common messages about hookah on Twitter.

results.name: Blood Pressure Measurement at Pediatric Care Visits
results.description: Data from this study document high compliance with recommendations that blood pressure measurement should be part of examinations at well-child visits; however, only 69% of nonwell-child primary care visits included blood pressure measurements.

results.name: Lasting Effects of Cancer Detection Programs
results.description: Researchers found that women who participated in the Breast and Cervical Cancer Early Detection Program (BCCP) in Ohio were nearly twice as likely as low-income non-BCCP women to have undergone screening mammography in the previous year.

results.name: Activity Profiles of Active Seniors
results.description: In this study, researchers concluded that the relationship between activity intensity and caloric expenditure in athletic seniors in British Columbia is similar to that observed in young adults, but active older adults still spend a substantial proportion of the day engaged in sedentary behaviors.

results.name: Housing Insecurity and Health Outcomes
results.description: Researchers find that Washington State residents who were worried or insecure about their housing situation were about twice as likely as those who were not housing insecure to report poor or fair health status or delay doctor visits because of costs.

results.name: Very Light Smoking Among Young Women
results.description: This study examines the differences between the sociodemographic and psychosocial factors associated with young women who are very light smokers and similar women who are at other smoking levels.

results.name: Health Insurance Expansions and Hypertension
results.description: Federal and state efforts to expand insurance coverage among nonelderly adults could produce significant health benefits in terms of cardiovascular disease occurrence and death rates, researchers find.

results.name: Trends in Cancer Death Rates
results.description: Researchers predict that the total number of cancer deaths from 2007 to 2020 will increase more than 10% among men and black women and will begin to stabilize among white women, increasing only 4.4% during this period.

results.name: A Guide to Health Care Study Design
results.description: This article focuses on a fundamental question: which types of health care studies are most trustworthy? That is, which study designs are most immune to the many biases and alternative explanations that may produce unreliable results?

results.name: National Asian-Language Smokers’ Quitline
results.description: The objective of this study was to examine characteristics of callers of the national Asian Smokers’ Quitline, how they heard about the quitline, and their use of the service.

results.name: Smoke-Free Policies in Multiunit Housing
results.description: In this study, researchers found that people living in multiunit housing with smoke-free policies engaged in less use of various tobacco products.

results.name: Many Children Not Protected by Smoke-Free Home Rules
results.description: Voluntary smoke-free home rules protect children from dangerous secondhand cigarette smoke – yet more than a third of US homes with a parent who smokes have no such rule, researchers find.

results.name: Cigarette Use and Smoking Prevalence in Kansas
results.description: Researchers find that smoking prevalence declined in Kansas between 1999 and 2010 – but the average annual number of cigarettes smoked stayed the same.

results.name: Nutrition Practices in Family Child-Care Homes
results.description: Researchers explored nutrition-related practices and attitudes of family child-care home providers in Rhode Island and assessed whether these differed by provider ethnicity or socioeconomic status of the enrolled children.

results.name: Drinking Water Availability in Child Care Sites
results.description: The aims of this study were to identify how water was provided to young children in child care and to determine the extent to which water access changed after a federal and state child care beverage policy was instituted in 2011 and 2012 in California.

results.name: NYC Adults Report Sitting 7-Plus Hours Every Day
results.description: The average New Yorker reports sitting for more than 7 hours per day—and may actually sit still even longer, according to this study.

results.name: Alcohol Outlets’ Impact on Violent Crime
results.description: Reducing the number and concentration of bars, restaurants, and other locations where people can go to drink in the Buckhead neighborhood of Atlanta, Georgia significantly reduced violent crime, researchers find.

results.name: Colonoscopy Screening Rates
results.description: Despite a 5-fold increase in colonoscopy screening rates since 2005, rates among first-degree relatives younger than the conventional screening age of 50 have lagged, researchers find.

results.name: Program Could Help Reduce Childhood Obesity
results.description: The objective of this study was to evaluate the impact of the Alliance for a Healthier Generation’s Healthy Schools Program on the prevalence of overweight and obesity in California schools, from inception in 2006 through 2012.

results.name: The Most Distinctive Causes of Death by State
results.description: This GIS map depicts a variety of distinctive causes of death based on a wide range of number of deaths, from 15,000 deaths from HIV in Florida to 679 deaths from tuberculosis in Texas.

results.name: Smoking in Georgia Restaurants and Bars
results.description: Researchers found that the percentage of restaurants and bars in Georgia that allowed smoking nearly doubled, from 9.1% in 2006 to 17.6% in 2012.

results.name: Depression and Unemployed Young Adults
results.description: The findings from this study suggest that unemployed emerging adults have 3 times greater odds of reporting depression compared with employed emerging adults.

results.name: Reducing Chronic Disease Through Policy Changes
results.description: In this process evaluation researchers identified specific challenges and facilitators to building and implementing a regional public health model to reduce chronic disease risk factors through policy, environment, and systems changes.

results.name: Disparities in Idaho Breast Cancer Diagnosis
results.description: This study suggests that disparities may exist for Idaho Women’s Health Check enrollees in the timely diagnosis of breast cancer.

results.name: Secondhand Smoke Among Pregnant Women in China
results.description: According to this study, 60% to 70% of pregnant women in the Henan and Sichuan Provinces of China are exposed to secondhand smoke and 50% to 60% of pregnant women are exposed to secondhand smoke at home.

results.name: Program Teaches Latinos About Heart Health
results.description: The objective of this study was to implement cardiovascular health promotion and disease prevention activities of the Salud para su Corazón model in a high-risk, impoverished, urban community in Mexico City.

results.name: Program Leads to Better Nutrition Habits
results.description: Researchers find that areas in California with the greatest amount of residents receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program–Education was associated with adults and children eating more fruits and vegetables and adults eating fast food less frequently.

results.name: Physical Activity of Urban Public School Children
results.description: Racial/ethnic minority children residing in low-resource areas of St. Louis, Missouri, may benefit the most from school-based opportunities for moderate-to-vigorous physical activity, according to this study.

results.name: Memory Loss Affects Millions in US
results.description: Based on the results of this study, researchers found that an estimated 4 million households in 13 US states have a member suffering with increased confusion or memory loss, potentially affecting more than 10 million people.

results.name: Communications Program Teaches About Health
results.description: This study outlines a communications project in Lima, Peru, aimed at helping students learn about noncommunicable disease prevention and how to promote health-related messages to their peers.

results.name: Diets of Childbearing Women
results.description: Researchers compared diet quality among childbearing women with a history of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) with the diet quality of childbearing women without a history of GDM.

results.name: Evaluation of Health Impact Assessments
results.description: The Center for Community Health and Evaluation conducted a 3-year evaluation to assess results of health impact assessments in the United States and to identify elements critical for their success.

results.name: Trends in Heart Disease Risk Factors
results.description: From 2001 to 2010, researchers found a significant increase in the prevalence of high cholesterol, diabetes, and obesity in the Mississippi Delta. They also observed racial differences in those prevalences.

results.name: MCCs Among Outpatient Pediatric Patients
results.description: Researchers analyzed outpatient evaluation and management claims for patients under age 18 years and insured by the Beaumont Employee Health Plan to study multiple chronic conditions prevalence, cost, and use from 2008 through 2013.

results.name: Family Income and Children’s Health
results.description: Researchers find that children with lower family incomes tend to have less healthy physical fitness status and have higher risk of obesity than children with higher family incomes.

results.name: Food Insecurity and Hypertension
results.description: To evaluate the impact of food insecurity on blood pressure reduction in a pilot clinical trial, researchers tested the effectiveness of 2 behavioral interventions for hypertension in people with and without food security.

results.name: Tobacco Ads at SNAP and WIC Stores
results.description: Researchers investigated the relationship between the amount and type of tobacco advertisements on tobacco outlets and the outlet type and location.

results.name: Patient Perspectives on Tobacco Cessation
results.description: Researchers explored smokers’ personal interactions with health care providers to better understand what it is like to be a smoker in an increasingly smoke-free era and the resources needed to support quit attempts and to better define important patient-centered outcomes.

results.name: Behavioral Health Care and Tobacco Control
results.description: To address the needs of smokers who experience psychological distress, the California Tobacco Control Program surveyed county and private behavioral health care programs to assess their readiness for adopting tobacco control strategies at behavioral health treatment facilities.

results.name: Chronic Conditions and Health Spending
results.description: The objective of this study was to estimate the annual average total expenditures and out-of-pocket spending burden among US adults by combinations of conditions.

results.name: Hypertension Facebook Groups
results.description: In this study, researchers analyzed Facebook groups related to hypertension to characterize their objectives, subject matter, member sizes, geographical boundaries, level of activity, and user-generated content.
